titlestmt.subtitle: Papers of Clayton Eshleman at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana
titlestmt.author: Electronic finding aid encoded by Indiana University Libraries.

change.item: Edits and rearrangement of content into requisite Lilly EAD structure, including addition of abstract, bioghist, scopecontent, controlaccess, relatedmaterial, and c01 levels of container list. Haley Suby.
Batch update to change subject links.

did.abstract: The Eshleman mss. II, 1953-1973, are the writings of poet Clayton Eshleman, 1935- , given by him to Black Sparrow Press publisher John Martin during the early 1970's.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Clayton Eshleman, 1935- , is a poet who was born in Indianapolis, Indiana, known for his translation work.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Eshleman mss. II, 1953-1973, consists of the writings of poet Clayton Eshleman, 1935- , given by him to Black Sparrow Press publisher John Martin during the early 1970's. Two letters to Martin from Eshleman complete the collection. See the Manuscripts Department catalog for further information on the writings.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Eshleman mss., Eshleman mss. III, also located at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Eshleman mss. II, Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
